item.title: Webbed Narratives: the Spider-Verseâ€™s Cinematic Leap into Imagination
item.description: The following is a research paper I wrote for a college course I’m taking. While it was originally meant to be five pages, it ended up being 19 by the time I finished writing all my thoughts. Enjoy the blood, sweat, and tears that went into this. For the longest time, animations have tried to mimic real-life imagery through their lighting, framing, characters, and setting. But what happens when animators break that boundary?
